attributes.action: Make E scooters legal on bike lanes
attributes.background:
As e scooters are illegal 
And they are more efficient to the country 
Why can’t we have a limit on speed then allow them to go in bike lnes.  Already London have scooter trials. But why can’t we take our own scooters. To the roads.  
Helps climate change 
Pollution 
And emissions
attributes.additional_details:
As it will make the planet more green 
And safe. More better London

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Legalize the use of e-scooters where bikes can be used: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583107

Allow E-scooters and Electric Skateboards in cycle lanes and on roads: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578486

attributes.action: Charge cyclists for reckless endangerment where they refuse to use cycle paths
attributes.background: Use the current Road Safety laws/Road Traffic Act to prosecute cyclists for reckless endangerment when they refuse to use available cycle routes on busy roads. Cycle paths are made available for the benefit of all road users, to reduce risk of injury, reduce congestion and reduce pollution.
attributes.additional_details: A great amount of money has been spent on improving the cycle routes throughout the UK, and many cycle routes now provide better access than by road. Yet many cyclists pay little attention to cycle routes and will refuse to use them even when informed of their presence. The refusal to use available cycle routes creates unnecessary danger, unnecessary congestion and unnecessary pollution. One cyclist can cause miles of traffic (destroying green benefits) and huge hindrance to emergency services.

rejection.details:
Decisions about investigating alleged offences and prosecuting these are a matter for the police and Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or House of Commons.

You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593714

attributes.action: Change 30 mph speed limit to a maximum of 20 mph where there are pedestrians.
attributes.background: To improve the safety of residents, school children and shoppers using all pavements next to roads. This to be added to all situations across the board where the current speed limit is not 20 mph.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently many 20 mph zones - why can't this apply everywhere?
At a stroke - reduced speed will improve the safety of pedestrians, decrease pollution from exhaust and noise.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see speeds reduced on certain roads, but we're not sure exactly what roads you want speed limits to be reduced on. Pedestrian are free to walk along the side of any carriageway other than a motorway or a motorway slip road, but we don't think you want the Government to reduce the speed limit for all such roads.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what roads you would like the Government to change speed limits for.

attributes.action: Change the national Speed limit on motorways to at least 80mph
attributes.background:
The 70mph speed limit has been in 1967 when cars were more dangerous and not as well equipped. 

Considering it’s 2021 and we have more eco friendly, more sophisticated and more well designed automated cars it makes sense to increase motorway limits.
attributes.additional_details:
I think maybe 100mph is too dangerous at the moment especially with the infrastructure we have considering Germany has no limit but they do have 7 lane motorways which the UK doesn’t have. 
However increasing the motorway limit to 80mph -90mph would be more efficient especially as we start to see more smart motorways and the introduction of electric cars meaning less pollution.  Cars are a lot of sophisticated from the 60s and our laws should reflect that.

rejection.details: We're not sure whether you want a speed limit of 80 or 90mph. You could start a new petition calling for whichever speed you would like to see happen.

attributes.action: Establish mandatory buffer zones of a minimum of 10 metres,next to watercourses.
attributes.background: Our rivers and streams are part of our National Infrastructure. River and stream margins protect our rivers and streams, store water, clean water, provide important habitat for our wildlife and store carbon. Many of our margins are lost through agriculture and development.
attributes.additional_details:
Development on floodplains is a prime cause of catastrophic flooding.
Soil erosion from fields cost the taxpayer £150million per year (Cranfield University 2009) Margins stop the soil leaving the fields.
The mandatory buffer zones will reduce the run-off into rivers of pesticides and fertilisers used in agriculture.
 Wilder river and stream corridors created through mandatory buffer zones  will reduce flooding, reduce pollution, capture carbon, help biodiversity, help business and help people

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about development near watercourses, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition calls for "buffer zones", but doesn't say what these should involve.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Remove flower pot barriers from Holmesdale Road in south norwood.
attributes.background: Its a unnecessary road closure that's causing more congestion and this is creating more pollution to the area, there are school children that are back and forth on the congested high street that are breathing in the toxins and the roads are more unsafe to be on as there is more traffic around.

rejection.details:
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Allow the sale of clean energy Electrofuel & Biomethane cars as soon as possible
attributes.background: The Government must allow the sale of cars that run on clean energy fuels for example, Electrofuels / Efuels & Biomethane to reduce or even reverse CO2 levels. These cars should be allowed to be sold in order to reduce dependence on Lithium the extraction of which is very damaging to the environment
attributes.additional_details:
Liquid fuels will use a normal fuel pump, with no need for environmentally damaging changes to roads everywhere.
Battery manufacture creates higher co2 emissions, are expensive and will need to be replaced after only a few years.
Cobalt mining is still using Child Labour.
Biomethane can be CO2 negative full lifecycle thereby reducing carbon levels.
Biomethane is more biodiverse & can be made from waste reducing pollution.
Combustion engine cars are more affordable for those on a lower income.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see more cars running on clean energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

Cars that use clean fuels, including non-fossil methane, are already allowed to operate in the UK. You can find out more about what fuels can be used in road vehicles here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/fuels-for-use-in-vehicles-excise-notice-75

attributes.action: Continue the ban on insect-damaging neonicotinoid thiamethoxam on all crops.
attributes.background: We ask that the recent decision to allow the use of the insect-damaging neonicotinoid thiamethoxam on sugarbeet is reversed.  It isn't allowed in the European Union and should not be used here either. We were promised there would be no lowering of environmental standards as part of Brexit changes.
attributes.additional_details:
Bees & other insects are proven to be hurt by neonicotinoids. They are also threatened by climate change & pollution.  
Insects are vital for a healthy environment, including for growing food.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: STOP THE EXPANSION OF THE LONDON ULEZ ZONE
attributes.background: CANCEL the Expansion of the ULTRA LOW EMISSIONS ZONE to the LONDON North & South Circulars.
attributes.additional_details: The Expansion of ULEZ will cause many businesses around the periphery of London to suffer financially as it will discourage people from coming into London. Covid has caused financial hardship & this extra charge is not acceptable to those who work & live in or around London. Asking people to buy new cars at this time is not acceptable after the hardship the Covid Lockdowns have & are causing. CANCEL the planned expansion of ULEZ. The Expansion of the ULEZ Zone is NOT acceptable as the outer zone of London is not as heavily built up and therefore pollution is not as high and can disperse more easily. Businesses & people must be helped at this time not hindered.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for the London Assembly and the London Mayor.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of all fireworks due to the pollution they cause.
attributes.background: We want the government to act responsibly during this pandemic and ban fireworks sale/use altogether and seek cleaner, safer alternatives. Fireworks cause air pollution-air pollution causes respiritory problems-Covid19 thrives on respiritory problems. This needs done before the festive period 2020.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks cause extensive air pollution in a short amount of time, leaving metal particles, dangerous toxins, harmful chemicals and smoke in the air for hours and days. Some of the toxins never fully decompose or disintegrate, but rather hang around in the environment, poisoning all they come into contact with. The UK government should have already made this decision especially with Covid19 present. Other countries have banned them for this reason, it's time the UK government did also.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign this petition:

Ban the use of all fireworks in order to reduce air and noise pollution.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334448

attributes.action: Removal of new Bus Gate on St Chads A4400 & Colmore Row in Birmingham
attributes.background: Get Birmingham City Council to remove the needless bus gates at St Chads A4400 & Colmore Row.
attributes.additional_details: The gates are are creating traffic, and with standing traffic come increases in pollution. The gate is leading traffic to blocking routes to the back of the Children’s Hospital. If they remove the gate, the traffic immediately dissipates. We the citizens of Birmingham, so NOT want our city covered in buss gates!

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for Birmingham City Council.

You can petition Birmingham City Council directly: https://www.birmingham.gov.uk/info/20146/consultation_and_engagement/702/petitions

attributes.action: Put water fountains in public to reduce people buying single-use plastic bottles
attributes.background: Putting water fountains in public spaces will mean that people buy less single use plastic bottles. Plastic is destroying our Earth, clogging our oceans and killing our wildlife. Water fountains will let you refill your bottle without polluting the oceans.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic pollution is becoming a big problem (by 2050 there will be more plastic than fish in the oceans). Water fountains in public are common in other European countries - so why aren’t they here? It is a free way for people to save the environment. Placing just one water fountain in a public space could save our Earth and stop polluting our seas. There isn’t a Planet B so we need to do all we can to stop this plastic problem.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334268

attributes.action: Ban plastic bags
attributes.background: In April 2020 the government had promised to ban plastic bags. Due to coronavirus this got delayed and then cancelled. Now the government is saying in April 2021 they will increase the charge on plastic bags to 10p saying that the 'war on plastic' has been 'stepped up'. This is not good enough.
attributes.additional_details: Currently 8 million pieces of plastic pollution find their way into our oceans everyday. This kills one marine mammal or sea bird every 30 seconds. If countries like Rwanda and Kenya can ban disposable plastic bags, then the UK can. We can do better than just charging 10p, we can ban plastic bags completely. This was set to happen anyway in April 2020 and it has not. There is no excuse. The UK government needs to keep to its promises and do more to tackle this pandemic of plastic pollution.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328310

attributes.action: Keep our air clean! Accelerate the adoption of electric cars through tax breaks
attributes.background: The government introduced a 0% benefit in kind tax for electric cars on company car schemes in April. We want this benefit or a similar one rolled out for people that can't access company schemes with the idea that it would massively reduce the cost of electric cars and thus speed up adoption.
attributes.additional_details: Because air pollution causes up to 36,000 deaths a year. We have a once in a lifetime opportunity to make a better more progressive U.K. let’s not waste it.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to incentivise uptake of electric cars, but it's not clear how you want the Government to do this.

Tax reliefs on company cars can only apply to people who have company cars. You could start a petition calling on the Government to increase grants or reduce VAT for people buying electric cars, if that is what you want to happen.

attributes.action: reward businesses for being environmentally friendly
attributes.background: give rewards like drop tax or encourage people to use businesses who focus on having low levels of pollution and/or plastic waste.
attributes.additional_details: climate change is a huge problem that will affect everyone and many big businesses put lots of pollution into the world and put lots of waste into the world with businesses producing many items with excessive plastic wrapping and with much of this going to waste. along with plastic needing 1000s of years to decompose. our seas filling with plastic and killing many animals and the planet. businesses that work to stop themselves from having high pollution and dropping plastic waste should be rewarded by the government. they should also be recognised and people should be made aware of businesses that work to do this to try and encourage the UK public to shop sustainably.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Government already provides some incentives for businesses to operate in more environmentally sustainable ways. You can find more information here: https://www.gov.uk/green-taxes-and-reliefs

You may wish to sign this petition:
Rebuild the economy out of lockdown with a Green New Deal
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343
            
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Banning production and sale of disposable BBQs
attributes.background: Banning production and sale of disposable BBQs
attributes.additional_details:
Disposable BBQs are extremely wasteful and dangerous.

They are one use consumable items that add to pollution.

They are a major cause of forest fires as people light them on irresponsibly when visiting forests.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Prioritise a green economic and environmental recovery following coronavirus
attributes.background:
Speed up legislation addressing climate change
Consult relevant organisations about far-reaching solutions
Stop supporting companies and projects that pollute the environment e.g. HS2.
Nurture the natural environment 
Motivate companies to "green-up" via financial incentives
attributes.additional_details:
This affects all of our lives, and impacts on our children and future generations.  What is the point of anything if we can't live on this planet?
Put people before profit and change our ways of thinking and acting.
Covid-19 gives us this opportunity, please take it.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Keep our air clean. We don’t want to go back to how it was!
attributes.background: Accelerate the use of electric vehicles by giving private owners the same tax breaks as companies now. Increase road tax on the worst petrol and diesel engines and accelerate there demise while helping people to switch. Also roll out the increased ULEZ zone now and increase the charge. Let us breath
attributes.additional_details:
Because air pollution causes more deaths than covid-19. Up to 36,000 a year. We have a once in a lifetime opportunity to make a better more progressive U.K. let’s not waste it. 

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/public-health-england-publishes-air-pollution-evidence-review

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about emissions, but it's not exactly what action you want the Government to take, and the Government isn't responsible for one of the things you have requested.

We can't accept petitions about the ULEZ because this is the responsibility of the London Assembly, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following related petitions which you might like to sign:

Protect the Environment – support carbon neutral energy alternatives: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300000

Publish new carbon budgets linked to the Paris Agreement and Climate Change Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300178

Ban the manufacture and sale of new cars that are solely powered by fossil fuels: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319725

If you want the Government to take a specific action not covered by the above, such as increasing road tax or increasing incentives for ULEV owners, you could start a new petition requesting this.

attributes.action: Encourage UK supermarkets to use less plastic in their packaging.
attributes.background: We would like the government to promote a limitation of plastic and an elimination of non-recyclable plastic in UK supermarkets’ packaging. Supermarkets have many products unnecessarily wrapped in plastic. The proposed change would reduce plastic pollution in our oceans.
attributes.additional_details: We would like you to do this as packaging has been found to be one of the main sources of sea pollution. A truckload of plastic is released into the ocean every minute and supermarkets produce approximately 800,000 tons every year. It is estimated that over 100 million marine animals are killed each year by plastic waste. Help us change this devastating number.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300152

attributes.action: Make home working compulsory for employees that are able to do so.
attributes.background: Force employers to instruct employees to work from home where the employees position allows them to do so.
attributes.additional_details: the strain covid-19 has put on our NHS has highlighted how fast a virus can spread. The technology exists for many employees to perform their working duties from home, drastically reducing the rate at which a virus can spread, alleviating the pressure on our NHS that future viruses similar to covid-19 may cause. Further benefits will be a reduction in the UKs pollution emissions with less employees travelling to work and Better work/life balance helping reduce mental health issues.

rejection.details:
The Government has imposed a number of restrictions on individuals and businesses as a result of the coronavirus outbreak. You can find out what you can and can't do here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/coronavirus-outbreak-faqs-what-you-can-and-cant-do/coronavirus-outbreak-faqs-what-you-can-and-cant-do

If you want the Government to consider closing down offices and businesses and ordering home working, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301439

If you want the Government to close all businesses that are not vital, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308122

If you want the Government to implement a complete lockdown, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310805

If you want the Government to close all shops including supermarkets, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310341

If you want the Government to close all unnecessary businesses including takeaways, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307294

If you would like the Government to close all non-essential online stores and warehouses, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311765

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read correspondence with Government Ministers asking further questions: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: Action on Non Exhaust Emissions
attributes.background: The proposed Clean Air Act must include legislation on non exhaust emissions - these are particles from tyres, the road surface and plasticisers. Also known as PM2.5, the major source of these invisible microparticulate pollution are buses and lorries.
attributes.additional_details:
Environmentally friendly and sustainable transport solutions must be found for our busy towns and cities which should include light rail systems.
The government should agree to the establishment of a local transport infrastructure fund to enable transport authorities to develop sustainable alternatives including light rail

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We understand you want action on emissions, but we're not sure what you'd like the Government to do, such as a ban or increased taxation. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: The Government should subsidize Green Technology e.g. Electric Cars
attributes.background: The Government should help businesses that help the planet to grow. Money should be given to help them do more to tackle climate change. Electric Cars are an example.
attributes.additional_details: Climate Change needs to be dealt with and this is a way to do it. Taking the Electric Cars example, car pollution is a big thing and electric cars will take more petrol cars off the roads. Wind Turbines and Solar Panels should also be subsidized to build more renewable energy for the UK.

rejection.details: https://www.gov.uk/plug-in-vehicle-grants

attributes.action: Fuel compensation to drivers for road works diversions for 8 miles or more
attributes.background: Any road closures should cause minimal disturbances and better planning should be provided by the construction company
attributes.additional_details: road diversion can cause colossal inconvenience to working life for road users, which is not the cause of own fault and if a long diversion is in place, it only right that traffic user be compensated especially as we already have to pay a road tax. Road diversion and lack of route planing is the cause of many issues inc accidents, pollution and chaos. its not right that traffic users should suffer the cost of completing a long diversion, due to unforeseen issues when road closures are enforced.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about disruption to traffic resulting from construction work, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition refers to compensation, but it's not clear what compensation you want motorists to be entitled to, or who you want to be liable to pay this.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Adapt Water Protection Laws to what they were Pre-Brexit
attributes.background: In recent years, after Brexit, Water Pollution has massively increased within river systems within England, as they have repealed most of the Water Protection laws that were EU laws. In order to have a government that cares for the people, we need our water systems to be safe from pollutants.
attributes.additional_details: Water Pollution has been scientifically proven to have adverse and damaging effects on the natural local biodiversity of environments across river basins and a dramatic effect on human health for those residing in river basins which are affected by Water Pollution. With the government's help in reinstating European Union water protection laws, we can ensure that the British Public has access to clean and safe rivers without the risk of chemical, thermal and environmentally damaging pollution

rejection.details:
It is not the case that most EU laws relating to water have been repealed, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Keep retained EU environmental laws until equal or stronger UK laws introduced: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623839

attributes.action: Provide free public transport for under 19's in full-time education.
attributes.background: We want to provide all under 19's in full-time education with free public transport across the nation.
attributes.additional_details: With the cost of living increasing, the nations youth are finding it more expensive to travel around the country. This is increasing reliance on parents/carers to provide the funds for their public transport, or to take the children themselves, causing increased levels of pollution, traffic, and road deterioration. If under 19's were granted free public transport, roads would become clearer, the air cleaner - reducing the risk of respiratory illness, and money would be saved on road repairs.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616644

attributes.action: Working from home by law.
attributes.background: I want the Government push by law Working from home scheme. Where is possible and force company and businesses, even the Government itself  to make this possible.
attributes.additional_details: Working from home will tackle cost of living crisis, will enhance family bond depopulate city centers and will decreased mayor traffic jam in rush hour and pollution. Workers will be in friendly environment productivity will increase.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not sure whether you want a requirement or a right to work from home, where possible. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Halt new housing development until new sewage processing infrastructure is built
attributes.background: Halt approval for new housing development in Oxfordshire until new sewage processing infrastructure is built that can deal with future demand as well as future flooding events WITHOUT polluting our rivers with raw sewage.
attributes.additional_details: Wildlife and ecosystems are dying due to lack of government funding in sewage processing infrastructure. This has led to a situation where sewage plants cannot deal with current demand. Meanwhile new housing projects proliferate wherever you look which will only add to the problem. We need to address the root cause and solve it. Plan and build new sewage processing infrastructure that will cope with future demands plus future flooding events without releasing raw sewage into our rivers.

rejection.details:
Decisions relating to applications for planning permission are a matter for the relevant local authority - in this case, Oxfordshire County Council - not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could have a petition calling for the Government to provide local authorities with funding to improve sewage processing infrastructure, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/601730

attributes.action: Companies to make their consumers aware of how much CO2 is produced per item.
attributes.background: 36000 people die prematurely in the UK alone every year due to air pollution. I believe companies need to be honest about how much of that they are causing. People are then able to make informed choices, which they are unable to do atm. This includes all purchases made in the UK
attributes.additional_details: People's quality of life, rich or poor is depleting, more people are developing COPD and other respiratory conditions. Ice caps are melting bringing more viruses and possible pandemics, water levels rising making less space for people to live. Temperatures rising causing more fires and more temperature rises. This isn't something that will happen in 100s of years, it's happening now, earth is becoming inhabitable because we are not doing enough. Hold all of us accountable.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We understand you're concerned about the impact of air pollution, but we're not sure what specific action you want companies to take in response, or what specific action you want the UK Government or Parliament to take in order to compel or help achieve this. We can only accept petitions calling for an action for which the UK Government and Parliament is responsible.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Regulate and restrict parking for uber motorcycle and scooter delivery drivers
attributes.background:
Regulate and restrict uber motorcycle and scooter delivery drivers from waiting in residential areas and pay and display parking bays without paying for tickets and with no consideration for other road users and residents 
This has a significant impact on air quality and can be unsafe
attributes.additional_details:
I have noticed it is having a big impact on other local businesses and residents as they often park without considering others and cause noise and air pollution often in heavily populated areas 
A local cafe/ restaurant in Enfield that has brought a much needed alternative to the area and created a wonderful space in what was an underused side road is overrun with uber drivers that park outside which impacts on diners.  Additionally the residents above are often disturbed late into the night

rejection.details:
The management of parking spaces in a residential area, and enforcement of any parking restrictions, is a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or House of Commons. The Government is therefore not directly responsible for the action this petition calls for.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Make multi-layer material consumer food packaging compostable by 2030 in the UK
attributes.background: Parliament must vote to make mixed material consumer food packaging in the UK compostable and a legal requirement by 2030. Multi-layer material packaging e.g. crisp packets must use compostable packaging such as PLA. Goods that do not meet these regulations by 2030 will be taxed.
attributes.additional_details: The UK can set the example, leading change in the global market using our consumer power. Producers must adapt to a changing world, and shift to working under a circular economy. This legislation can begin this change. Although supplementary, we must look past recycling to instead reduce the use of plastic, reverse waste pollution and the growing damage of micro plastics. Our consumption can be reformed and this ambition to reduce our plastic production can be realised with this call for change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

It's not clear if you want the Government to ban multi-layer consumer food packaging that isn't compostable, or just introduce additional taxes for packaging that isn't compostable.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Reimburse tax payers for the cycle paths created that are no longer needed.
attributes.background: Either change the law back or reimburse tax payers money that has gone towards cycle paths ie. In Headington Oxfordshire and similar places where the law now states that they don’t have to use the millions of pounds worth of cycle paths that have been put in place.
attributes.additional_details: Multiple accidents regarding cyclists and lorrys have already effected the Oxfordshire and surrounding areas. The Government has not taken into account that this will cause more fatalities on the roads and create more traffic which will only increase the pollution figures. People are going to get seriously injured and the Government has a duty of care to rethink this process and change it to a realistic law.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Cycle lanes have never been compulsary to be used by cyclists. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as making it compulsary for cycle lanes to be used when provided.

attributes.action: Net Zero. PM to hold a full independent enquiry focusing on economic outcomes.
attributes.background:
Whilst there appears to be a change to the world climate, we in the UK are one of the smallest contributors to emissions.

We are in danger of bankrupting our country, while the larger nations, China and India, continue as they are, causing pollution, which makes our efforts pointless.
attributes.additional_details:
In ceasing to use our own coal and gas, we are importing inferior coal and gas from other countries. This is imported using ships and road transport. This of course, is increasing the very footprint that we are claiming to reduce. While we grow poorer by doing this, other countries continue to pollute and become richer.
We should continue to use our own fuels and explore the possibilities of alternatives, such as building smaller power plants, such as suggested by James Dyson. We can then navigate our way to reducing emissions in a sensible way.

Insisting that we all throw away our efficient gas boilers is not the answer.

We would like an urgent enquiry taking all aspects into account, followed by a debate in parliament and, if necessary, a referendum.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure if you want an inquiry on the "economic outcomes" of Net Zero or "all aspects"

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, or you might like to sign this petition

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599602

attributes.action: Ban single use plastics and the unnecessary use of plastic packaging
attributes.background: The change needs to start in super markets, big brands and companies. They need to be forced to change their packaging to sustainable material. Companies like Galaxy are already using a plant based packaging for their vegan chocolate, it can be done. Our oceans and planet need us to change.
attributes.additional_details: Single use plastics are polluting the world, they need to be banned. Our oceans are being destroyed. We actively ship recycling to other countries whose lands are polluted with our plastic waste. Single use masks are being discarded everywhere and being found in the oceans. Animals and their homes are dying. We are running out of room for anymore plastic wastage. It is in our water, air, fish, land. It has to stop. Mexico, Canada, Germany are doing this. We have a responsibility to do this too.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the use of plastics, but it's not clear exactly what plastics you want to be banned, and if you only want this ban to apply to certain businesses, or all.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban plastic packaging for fruit and vegetables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600128

Ban the use of plastic food packaging: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/595495

Ban all plastic packaging: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603901

attributes.action: Legislate plastics manufacturers to ditch oil & switch to biomass when available
attributes.background: Oil companies will resist giving way to bioplastics. Government should legislate to forbid oil producers from continuing to pollute our Planet. Biomass must be encouraged into the main production of plastics. It is an eco-friendy alternative and is relatively easy to tweak. Products already exist!
attributes.additional_details: Here is important research data: EUBP Facts and Figures - BIOPLASTICS. The amount of biomass needed dwarfs the total available in the Planet. This campaign will lead to a real improvement in plastic waste and carbon reduction. These are both vital if we are to reach carbon neutrality. Until now, this was wishful thinking. By contrast, there are so many developments that with legislation real improvements can come to life. The exact same plastic formulae can be used for all plastic items.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the use of oil to produce plastics, but we're not sure if you want the Government to ban plastics being produced using oil, or to do something else.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Establish Cabinet Office Briefing Rooms (COBR) for the climate emergency.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has been a global leader in the past and we have the opportunity to show real leadership to tackle the climate change crisis, biodiversity loss and pollution of nature and the impacts on or own health and well being.  We need emergency action and planning establishing COBR.
attributes.additional_details: The government has declared a climate emergency and the science is screaming at us we have to change now, as an emergency. COP 26 has just about kept "1.5" alive, but we need action. COBR is required to bring the planners, military strategists, business, individuals, innovators, and government together to set the plan to tackle the crisis and tell the world we are acting post COP 26 and listening to the public. Committees are not the answer for an emergency, we need action right now.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about Government action on climate change, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

COBR (or COBRA) is shorthand for the Civil Contingencies Committee that is convened to handle matters of national emergency or major disruption, and the briefing rooms referred to in the acronym are located in Whitehall.

There are already Cabinet Committees on Climate Action Strategy and Climate Action Implementation, but we could accept a petition calling on the Government to schedule COBR meetings to address the climate emergency, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Introduce a legal right for employees to work remotely
attributes.background: To introduce new laws to provide employees with the legal right to work from home where this is practical, with employers only able to refuse requests to work remotely with good reason.
attributes.additional_details: Covid-19 brought about a change in our working lives like we have never experienced before. For those who enjoy the new work life balance, less stress and expenses linked to the everyday commute, the possibility to work in the comfort of their home, to move to parts of the country that are cheaper, less crowded and less polluted and more time for themselves and those they love, this petition asks the Government to enshrine in law the right of employees to work from home.

attributes.action: Bring the CEO's of all UK water companies causing pollution to rivers to court.
attributes.background: The UK Government Amend all present legislation to bring the Directors and CEO's of all UK water companies to account  personally in the courts by means of personal summons when their company causes any pollution and or causes environmental harm to rivers and waterways of England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details:
Presently, Water Utilities are continually polluting rivers and waterways with daily impunity whilst the Regulators watch without action taken.
Making the CEO's and the Boards of Directors personally responsible along with the operational managers to account in the courts will ensure a greater application of due diligence thus imposing stronger measures to avoid claimed accidents when these are deliberate and or events that are clearly avoidable at any time by reducing incompetence.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about criminal action being brought in respect of water pollution, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

It is already possible for senior staff of corporate bodies to be prosecuted for environmental offences, where they have committed a relevant offence. You can read the Environment Agency's enforcement and sanctions policy here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/environment-agency-enforcement-and-sanctions-policy/environment-agency-enforcement-and-sanctions-policy

Decisions about investigating alleged offences and prosecuting these are an operational matter for the Environment Agency.

attributes.action: Fix the few Hyper-Emitting Powerplants which create 52% of CO2 Emissions
attributes.background:
Just 5% of the world’s power plants account for almost three-quarters of carbon emissions from electricity generation.
The UK could lead the charge in a crackdown on these few powerplants to make them more efficient.
attributes.additional_details:
This would result in a 25% decrease of emissions and switching their fuel source from coal or oil to natural gas could cut global emissions by almost 30%.
This would be a massive step forward for a reasonably small cost.
We're seeing our planet become more dangerous every day and our personal lifestyle choices are not enough to change this. 
We have to collaborate with other countries and crackdown on these super-polluters.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about emissions from certain power plants, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. In any case, the UK Government is only responsible for energy and environmental policy for the UK, not the rest of the world.

If there are particular actions you would like the Government to take in respect of UK-based power plants you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that all road works on arterial roads be carried out 24/7
attributes.background: I would like to see all road works carried out on arterial roads be carried out on a 24 hour day , 7 day a week to stop continuous traffic jams , additional pollution and loss of time to the road user
attributes.additional_details: As road users  we are use to delays and traffic jams due to the volume of today’s road users. One major problem is ongoing road works , this can seriously be eradicated if works on arterial roads we undertaken 24 hours a day , 7 days a week

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about how to manage roadworks are an operational matter for the relevant traffic authority, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

attributes.action: To stop Global Warming and care about the environmet

I want parliament to stop global warming. For the past 10 years the environment has gotten worse and worse and the United Kingdom
has been hotter and hotter in spring and summer and 2014 was the hottest year during the period of (1984-2020).
So I want to make a change by making parliament make prices cheaper for electric cars so pollution doesn't affect the environment in a bad way and for greenhouse gases not going to the Earth's Ozone layer and breaking it apart.

attributes.action: Say no to consett incinerator
attributes.background:
We want the government to stop Durham county council agreeing to the building of an incinerator to burn waste within the Consett area .
Ref. DM/20/03267/WAS
attributes.additional_details: Incinerators harm recycling; our air quality and contribute to climate change. Enmisions include dioxins, Box and ultrafine particulate matter that can be harmful to both human health and the natural environment, there is not enough monitoring, enforcement or transpararency by the industry. Traffic will increase having 22 HGV movements per day carrying waste in and out across the North East adding more pollution. A 50 meter stack will be much higher than any building in the area, therefore the night and industrial nature of this incinerator will cause substantial,adverse and permanent visual effects bringing unacceptable harm and retirement to the character of the landscape.

rejection.details: The decision on this planning application is a matter for Durham County Council, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Combat the problems involved with fast fashion
attributes.background: The government needs to enforce legislation which will put and end to the immoral and environmentally damaging industry of fast fashion. There are many severe problems involved with fast fashion, many involving the environment, the economy, and human rights.
attributes.additional_details: It is so important to prevent this because people do not realise the problems lying behind the fast fashion industry. Modern day slaves are being exploited in foreign countries. Children are paralysed from factories falling on them. Water and the environment are being polluted. 35% of all plastic in the sea is from polyester materials. 10% of carbon emissions are from garment factories. The government needs to target big brands like BooHoo and Primark before even more damage is caused!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of privately owned e-scooters on public roads
attributes.background:
The UK law states that you can ride a bike, drive a car or even saddle up a horse on the road, but not ride a privately owned e-scooter.
E-scooters are better for the environment, helping ease congestion and address pollution, so I am calling on the Government to legalise their use on public roads.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government has recognised the potential with e-scooter rental trials, but privately owned e-scooters aren’t allowed on the same roads. The UK laws should catch up with many of our European neighbours.
If made legal, the benefits include: they offer an alternative to public transport – for short journeys in particular, are simple to set up and ride and better for the environment. Any new regulations should deliver safer roads and ensure that users behave responsibly and with due care.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332067

attributes.action: Allow the sale of cars running on cleaner fuel like E85 & renewable Biomethane
attributes.background: The government should allow the sale and future development of cars that run on cleaner fuels such as E12 up to E85, and renewable Biomethane to cut CO2 and other emissions. Allow various liquid fuels to be sold and cars developed to run on it going forward to help reduce waste from batteries.
attributes.additional_details:
Alternative fuels use current infrastructure, so more affordable for those on a low income. Making Batteries releases high emissions. Electric cars have impracticalities - long charging, lower range & fast charging leads to shorter battery life & expense.
EVs are heavy, tyres wear faster, more tyre particle dust & road damage.
Some can't charge near home. EVs are too quiet, more accidents!
Human rights & Cobalt mining. Biomethane is more biodiverse and can be made from waste reducing pollution.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to make grants available for buying or developing cars that use renewable or cleaner fuels, or to exempt these vehicles from the ban on new petrol and diesel cars, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: make it illegal to buy or use fireworks other then bonfire night and new years

attributes.additional_details: During the periods of fireworks there is a high anxiety in animals not only just household animals but livestock as well this leading to post traumatic stress, loss of hearing and death. In a fireworks display, those particles that fall to the ground often contain propellant chemicals and colorants which find their way into the soil and our water systems.

attributes.action: Demand compensation from plastic producers for every British citizen.
attributes.background: I want parliament to force plastic producers to pay compensation to the public for the nuisance, unsightliness and danger of plastic pollution on land and at sea. Our wildlife, beaches, towns and countryside are awash with non-recyclable, non-biodegradable plastic and drastic action is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Companies in the business of producing plastic have historically misled the government and the public about how reusable and recyclable they are. Plastics are not very reusable or recyclable and the production of plastic needs to be halted unless it is shown to be wholly recyclable or biodegradable. In the meantime, restitution must be paid for the damage done by plastic pollution and the misleading information about resuability and recycling.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Compensation is a matter for the courts.

We could publish a petition calling for the Government to impose a levy on all plastic production in the UK, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Implement a tax on food packaged with any single use plastics
attributes.background: A tax on all food packaged with any single use plastics in order to persuade food suppliers to replace it with non-plastic alternatives. The tax should start low but increase over time to make plastic food packaging commercially unattractive. For example 10% in year 1, 25% in 2 two, 100% in year 3.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic pollution is a huge problem, and currently there is little commercial incentive towards change. Food is one of the markets where single use plastic is highly prevalent, yet alternatives exist - from traditional waxed paper, through to new technologies e.g. cellulose based packaging. The UK should be a world leader in the green economy, and this approach would help to drive investment in alternatives to our plastic-heavy economy.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315755
